item.title: Food rubbish dumped, 24th August
item.description:
At the locked silver gate which leads to the alley which starts at the back of 10 Lovel Avenue there is a large bag of dumped rotten fruit attracting pests. This is located in the alley which is between 8 and 10 Lovel Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linton Close, East Wickham, London

item.title: Foxes strewing rubbish everywhere every day from bin, 24th August
item.description:
We are having very bad problems with foxes on our road (Fellbrigg Rd) with as many as 10 or 12 foxes each night reaping havoc in gardens and leaving rubbish and poo strewn in gardens, and in some cases they are coming into peopleâ€™s windows and pooing in their house! A main contributor is the bin on the corner of Fellbrigg and Whateley Road, where foxes congregate and dive into the bin and tear open the bags of rubbish that the Southwark street teams have just collected. This means there is rubbish across the street every morning that the street team is then having to re-collect. The problem is driving all our neighbours mad! It means there is dog poo across the street from the bin in addition to the fox poo we find every morning on our front steps. The bin should be removed or replaced with a closed-top bin in order to help reduce the problem. Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Whateley Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two canisters of some pressured gas or liquid still there, 24th August
item.description:
I reported this issue and the update says it was fixed, but the two canisters remain there. They could explode if they get too hot with the son. I do not know their content.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
